intro: Caucalis lappulacea, commonly known as the lesser burnet, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, adapted to thrive in dry, well-drained soils. Caucalis lappulacea is often found in meadows, rocky areas, and along roadsides, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
